alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:50PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Fergus County through 215 PM MDT... At 150 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Lewistown, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Moore, Forestgrove, Giltedge, Glengarry, Hilger and Heath. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 67 and 110. Highway 191 between mile markers 1 and 2, between mile markers 1 and 12, and between mile markers 14 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In addition, frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for central Montana.
